wikipedia_page.main: James Crisp (born 11 October 1982 in Nottingham) is a British swimmer. He has won gold medals in the Paralympic Games as well as the IPC world and European championships, breaking numerous records in the process. He competes in S9 classification events after having contracted polio as a child.

Sean Tretheway
response: Sean competed as part of the New Zealand team at the 2000 Summer Paralympics in Sydney where he finished second behind Britain's James Crisp who set a new world record.  He also raced in the 100m and 400m freestyle but failed to make the final of either.
